title: Presentations of project results - HeavyRoute09

author: Anita Ihs, Swedish National Road and Transport Research Institute - VTI

segmentation: Oh, they have a root project started in.
September 2006.
And ends now in June, as you understand.
We have been eight partners working with this project.
Is this on?
Um?
Arsenal research and LCC and VTi research institutes.
We have navtech involved in the project also an PTV from Germany.
And also Ferland vertical.
And there as I said, you have in the previous presentation.
You've heard all about the problems with Rd freight transport and a good got a good picture of why we have carried out this project.
A great part of the freight transport is obviously carried out on roads and also the trend is towards longer and heavier week or so of course.
This has consequences such as been mentioned before.
Conjestion accidents, increased fuel consumption and emissions noise as well as road and bridge damage, so the overall objectives for our heavy route project and was.
Apply an combine existing and newly developed systems technologies, databases and models to develop an advanced route guidance and.
Driving support system in order to improve Rd safety and capacity and.
To reduce negative impacts on environment and also to reduce road and bridge maintenance costs.
And this these objectives of course means that there are several stakeholders for this project.
Not only fleet owners and planners and truck drivers, but also Rd authorities, road and bridge operators, service providers, truck manufacturers and also other Rd users.
And in the beginning of this project, of course we.
Assess the opinions of all these stakeholders through workshops, interviews and questionnaires.
We are focused on three main applications within heavy route, pre trip route planning, driver support and monitoring and management of heavy goods vehicles on bridges.
The pre trip.
Route planning is done in 2 steps.
First of all, to derive allowable routes.
Taking into consideration physical and legal restrictions of HPV and also considering if there are preferred truck networks and then which is?
A major part of heavy Route 2 Dear.
I recommended route taking into account environmental effects, vehicle operating cost, maintenance, cost and safety and so on.
But you will hear more details about this in the coming presentations.
This is just a picture of how the.
Work has been organized in the project.
We have had four 5 technical work packages.
And in principle you will hear presentations from each of these work packages during the day.
We also have a.
Website where you can find all the reports from this project.
Yeah.
So.
We are already running late.
It's a tight schedule, so let's get on with the presentations we will have.
Three presentations to begin with about the models and data, and.
Cost database and after that a panel discussion and.
I suggest that we do it like this that we have these three presentations and no questions.
And then we save the questions for the panel discussions and then there will be a coffee break.

And then after the coffee break, there would be presentations about the different applications and also about the traffic simulations on the cost benefit analysis that has been done and then we end with a panel discussion.
And some conclusions and then lunch.
So as I said, it's a tight schedule, so I would.
Like the speakers really to think about the time and I will be sitting there waving when time is out.
So then I would like to invite the first Speaker leave program from Vgi to talk about models and data.
